st:Section.p: Friends of the Creative Domain primarily uses a public wiki for managing information. Go there if you are looking to contribute or to find information on FCD activities.
If you want more information please contact Rufus Pollock (email: fcd-info [at] okfn.org, phone: 07795 176 976).

st:Section.h2: About Friends of the Creative Domain
st:Section.p: Friends of the Creative Domain was formed in mid 2004. Primarily created to encourage and support the BBC's efforts to make an open Creative Archive. It brought together groups who have a stake in the archive such as artists, archivists, academics, educators, and of course the license paying general public.
Since then it has retained its structure as a open community while the focus has evolved into a more general promotion of the public domain and of the creative commons.
For more information about the organization see the about page
There are various things you can do to participate:

ul.li: Make your views known about the Creative Archive or about music copyright extensions. For example you could write to your MP. This is extremely valuable way of demonstrating support or concern about an issue.
Join the creative-friends mailing list for discussion of this project, which you can sign up to here.
Tell others about Friends of the Creative Domain and the issues it promotes such as Creative Commons and the Creative Archive.
